pullRequest.title: Add ATs for on chain privacy with multi tenancy
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR description
Adding acceptance test for on-chain privacy with multi-tenancy
Changelog

 I thought about the changelog and included a changelog update if required.

commit.message:
all ATs working

Signed-off-by: Stefan Pingel <stefan.pingel@consensys.net>
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:hyperledger/besu into addATsForOnChainMultiTenancy

add ATs for on-chain privacy with multi-tenancy

Signed-off-by: Stefan Pingel <stefan.pingel@consensys.net>

add ATs for on-chain privacy with multi-tenancy

Signed-off-by: Stefan Pingel <stefan.pingel@consensys.net>

add the right resources

Signed-off-by: Stefan Pingel <stefan.pingel@consensys.net>

fix spdx headers

Signed-off-by: Stefan Pingel <stefan.pingel@consensys.net>

nodes.bodyText: Why do we need to make this optional? Isn't the idea of the builder that if you don't need this value you just don't call the keyFilePath  method?
And it looks like keyFilePath already starts as an empty.
Have you checked if we have the fields being returned by web3j? If we don't, it might be a good idea to keep the previous comment explaining why we are ignoring these fields.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,15 +43,7 @@ public void verify(final PrivacyNode node) {
     assertThat(actualReceipt)
         .usingRecursiveComparison()
         .ignoringFields(
-            "commitmentHash",
-            "logs",
-            "blockHash",
-            "blockNumber",
-            "logsBloom",
-            "transactionIndex") // TODO: The fields blockHash, blockNumber, logsBloom and
-        // transactionIndex have to be ignored as the class
-        // org.web3j.protocol.besu.response.privacy.PrivateTransactionReceipt does not contain these
-        // fields. Once web3j has been updated these ignores can be removed.
+            "commitmentHash", "logs", "blockHash", "blockNumber", "logsBloom", "transactionIndex")

nodes.bodyText: What are we gonna do about this? Does that mean that something is broken?
Is this a TODO or just an informative comment?
Why do we have these tests commented out? We don't need them or did you forget to uncomment them? :)
nit: if we're changing key1pub -> key1pubs, should we do the same ie key1key -> key1keys?
justAlice doesn't seem like the right name. Maybe privacyGroup ?
